thinking.disposable_income: McKinley Park has a median income of $70,411, with about 36.4% households earning less than $50,000. The per capita income of $32,106 suggests moderate disposable income levels, making residents somewhat sensitive to transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With mixed income levels and average household size of 2.8, many families need to balance essential expenses with discretionary spending. About 36.4% of households may have limited discretionary spending capacity
thinking.accessibility: The community shows diverse transportation usage: 51.5% drive alone, 21.7% use transit, and 12.7% carpool. 87.7% of households own at least one vehicle, indicating good car accessibility. The area needs balanced policies that serve both drivers and transit users
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized policies with moderate tax rates (1%) to balance revenue generation and household burden. 2. Favored lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to support the significant transit-using population. 3. Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to reduce congestion while not overly burdening the majority who drive. 4. Considered travel time improvements for both transit and car users. 5. Selected policies that provide good transit service while maintaining reasonable costs for lower-income households
